quoteFirst: In like manner the contractor for the Portishead, Clevedon, and Yatton mail cart service, after having driven over this route with immunity from accident for forty years, yet came to grief in the last week of his connection with His Majesty's mails, January, 1902. The contractor's time table was arranged thus:--Portishead, leave 9.15 p.m.; Clevedon, arrive 10.5 p.m., leave 10.50 p.m.; Yatton, arrive 11.28 p.m.; attend to apparatus and up mail
quoteLast: , down mail 12.42 a.m.; Yatton, leave 1.5 a.m.; Clevedon, arrive 1.48 a.m., depart 4.15 a.m.; Portishead, arrive 5.5 a.m.
title:
The King's Post
Being a volume of historical facts relating to the posts, mail coaches, coach roads, and railway mail services of and connected with the ancient city of Bristol from 1580 to the present time
author: Tombs, Robert Charles, 1842-1923

quoteLast: , while the Virginian was still plunging eastward, that all communication from the Titanic ceased. The Virginian's operator, with the Virginian's captain at his elbow, fed the air with blue flashes in a desperate effort to know what was happening to the crippled liner, but no message came back.
title: Sinking of the Titanic and Great Sea Disasters
author: Marshall, Logan, 1884-1937 [Editor]

quoteFirst: The boats were put into the water at
quoteLast: o'clock and went off to do the Spider Web. As they shoved out into the North Sea the fog shut down, and one boat, when forty miles from land, turned back.
title: The Spider Web: The Romance of a Flying-Boat War Flight
author: Hallam, T. D.

quoteFirst: We still continued to follow the gallery of lava, a perfect natural pathway, as easy of descent as some of those inclined planes which, in very old German houses, serve the purpose of staircases. This went on until
quoteLast: , the precise instant at which we rejoined Hans, who, having been somewhat in advance, had suddenly stopped.
title: A Journey to the Centre of the Earth
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteFirst: You are convinced--_convinced_--that the bombing of Waaku has already started a chain reaction. And that about
quoteLast: , around eight minutes from now, the shock wave will reach us, and then the wave of disintegration. Look out of the window! See that cactus in the sand, with its little yellow flower? It will be annihilated.
title: Chain Reaction
author: Ellanby, Boyd; Doktor [Illustrator]
